problem.markdown:
>>Using the same Howe Truss designed in Finding 1, which members are in compression? Check all that apply.<<
[x] The members along the top [x] The diagonal members [ ] The vertical members [ ] The members along the bottom
[explanation] When using the simulation, look at the colors of the segments and at the forces on the left side. The red beam AB has a force of 96kN, which is listed as -96kN since it's a compressive force. Now look at the blue beam AC and you can see it has a force of 75kN and is a positive number. This means it's a tensile force. [explanation]

div.p: When using the simulation, look at the colors of the segments and at the forces on the left side. The red beam AB has a force of 96kN, which is listed as -96kN since it's a compressive force. Now look at the blue beam AC and you can see it has a force of 75kN and is a positive number. This means it's a tensile force.
